content.description: On the left side of the South-facing face. Low sit start to an awkward mantle.
content.location: Located on the Heavy Metal Boulder AKA The V4s. From the parking area, the main Spook bouldering area is to the Southwest. Hike the steep the two-track down to the wash and then up to the single tracks trails above. From here you can take the right fork of the singletrack which switchbacks up to the main area by the cliffs. The bolder is about 30 feet East of the main wall at the top of the cliff.

content.description: The crux of this problem could be either holding the swing/not dabbing on the boulder directly behind you when doing the last move to the good jug just below the lip. The bottom moves are quite difficult and very tricky to decipher the easiest sequence.
content.location: Approaching the Main Wall, veer slightly right towards the top of the approach trail and you will see this boulder.

content.description: Tall and bad landing.  The chossy appearance of the rock had us spooked for a while but it turned out to be quite solid.  The moves are good, but the high second crux may leave you feeling spooked!
content.protection: Many pads will help, the landing is uneven and there is a boulder back there to smack your noggin on!
content.location: Just west of the trail to upper spook, before All Done boulder.  This boulder sticks up with a northeast-facing, slightly overhanging wall.  Strenuous sit start close to the boulder to the left and follow the line slightly right to a long reach and hueco near the summit.

content.description:
Starting low on a right hand slot and left hand sloper, make the big move on to the face to gain the sharp left hand crimp. Continue up the face via crimps to the final stab to a perhaps the sharpest pocket in the world. Top out.  

  Red Dwarf is a very good looking boulder, and the stone is immaculate, the highest quality at the box, it just happens to be ultra-sharp.  

  Can be done as a stand start via the two low crimps on the face, about V7.
content.location: A good walk around the corner from the Main Wall (to the south/to your left if you are facing Rubberband Fingers), you'll pass a bunch of small boulders and eventually they get bigger forming almost a pseudo cliff band.

content.description: Starts on the right side of the North-facing face.Sit start in the hole with both hands in the hueco. Traverse left through slopers and bad feet to the crux which is cranking up to the lip.
content.location: Located on the Heavy Metal Boulder AKA The V4s. From the parking area, the main Spook bouldering area is to the Southwest. Hike the steep the two-track down to the wash and then up to the single tracks trails above. From here you can take the right fork of the singletrack which switchbacks up to the main area by the cliffs. The bolder is about 30 feet East of the main wall at the top of the cliff.

content.description:
A short but fun climb. In the middle of the South face. Sit start on a crimpy sidepull and an undercling pocket. Go straight up the crimps. You can either make a somewhat awkward top out straight over the lip or make a semi-dynamic move to a jug out right and top out. If you are taller this problem may feel easier as you can get a good heel toe cam in the start hold that you can keep until the lip encounter. If you are shorter you will have to crank on the good incut crimps.  

  Bob Broilo's guide has a nice description behind the history of this climb: infohost.nmt.edu/~bob/bouldâ€¦
content.protection: This one is short, a pad should do just fine.
content.location: Located on the Heavy Metal Boulder AKA The V4s. From the parking area, the main Spook bouldering area is to the Southwest. Hike the steep the two-track down to the wash and then up to the single tracks trails above. From here you can take the right fork of the singletrack which switchbacks up to the main area by the cliffs. The boulder is about 30 feet East of the main wall at the top of the cliff.

content.description: Most folks struggle getting off the ground on this one, but it is not over yet.  Balancy moves up the face keep you thinking.  Often done as a highball boulder problem.
content.protection: Two-bolt anchor at the top. long slings help to extend over the edge. Top is accessed by scrambling up the right (west) side of the boulder.
content.location: On the large boulder just east of the open area at the base of Main spook. Mor or less just opposite of Spook Main Wall. Route goes up the north face.

content.description: There are several boulders of varying size infront of and to the sides of the Main Wall. Boulder problems of varying difficulty and even some TR anchors on at least one of the big boulders.
